conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball S_1 at point M.
Electric potential at point M is given by φ_M = (sqrt(2) k Q) / L from Figure (b).
Electric potential at point N is given by φ_N = (k Q) / (sqrt(2) L).
Calculate the electric potential difference between points M and N: Δφ = φ_M - φ_N = (k Q) / (sqrt(2) L).
Electric field at any point due to two point charges Q separated by a distance 2L can be calculated using the superposition principle.
Determine the electric field at point M: E = (k Q) / L^2.
Calculate the electric force on the small ball S_1 at point M: F_e = (k Q^2) / L^2.
The magnitude of the electric force experienced by the small ball S_1 at point M is (k Q^2) / L^2.
